enum.name: INST_OPCODE
enum.doc:
Unused operands of an instruction should have their use flag at 0.
Unless mentioned otherwise, instructions do the same for all four components of the vector-valued operands.
Operands src0,src1 and src2 can come from a temporary register or an uniform.

value.name: ADD
value.doc:
dst := src0 + src2
src0 is added to src1 and the result is put into temporary register dst.

value.name: MAD
value.doc:
dst := src0 * src1 + src2
src0 is multipied with src1, then src2 is added. The result is put into temporary register dst.

value.name: MUL
value.doc:
dst := src0 * src1
src0 is multipied with src1 and the result is put into temporary register dst.

value.name: DST
value.doc:
dst.x := 1 dst.y := src0.y * src1.y dst.z := src0.z dst.w := src1.w
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb219790%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

value.name: DP3
value.doc:
dst := src0.x * src1.x + src0.y * src1.y + src0.z * src1.z
Computes the component-wise dot product of the first three components between src0 and src1 and broadcasts the results to all destination components in temporary register dst.

value.name: DP4
value.doc:
dst := src0.x * src1.x + src0.y * src1.y + src0.z * src1.z + src0.w * src1.w
Computes the component-wise dot product between src0 and src1 and broadcasts the results to all destination components in temporary register dst.

value.name: MOV
value.doc:
dst := src2
Copies the value of operand src2 to temporary register dst.

value.name: MOVAF
value.doc:
dst := src2
Copies the floating point value of operand src2 to address register dst. XXX does this round or floor?

value.name: RCP
value.doc:
dst := 1.0 / src2
Computes the reciprocal of src2, and puts the result into temporary register dst.

value.name: RSQ
value.doc:
dst := 1.0 / sqrt(src2)
Computes the reciprocal of the square root of src2, and puts the result into temporary register dst.

value.name: LITP
value.doc: Appears to use input argument src0.yz and src1.yz. dst.x is always 1, dst.w is always 1. Probably http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb174703%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

value.name: SELECT
value.doc:
dst := src1 COND src0 ? src2 : src1 (binary condition) dst := COND(src0) ? src1 : src2 (unary condition)
Sets temporary register dst to src2 if (src1 COND src0) holds, otherwise to src1. This operation is performed per-component. It is used to implement MIN(a,b) and MAX(a,b) in the following way: - MIN(a,b): SELECT.GT dst, a, b, a (b > a ? a : b) - MAX(a,b): SELECT.LT dst, a, b, a (b < a ? a : b)

value.name: SET
value.doc:
dst := src0 COND src1
Sets temporary register dst to 1.0 if (src0 COND src1), otherwise to 0.0.

value.name: EXP
value.doc:
dst := exp2(src2.x)
Sets temporary register dst to the 2-exponent of the x component of src2). This is a scalar operation, the result is broadcasted over all active destination components.

value.name: LOG
value.doc:
dst := log2(src2.x)
Sets temporary register dst to the 2-log of the x component of src2). This is a scalar operation, the result is broadcasted over all active destination components.

value.name: FRC
value.doc:
dst := frc(src2)
Sets temporary register dst to the fractional portion of src2 for positive values. For negative values, the returned value will be 1.0 - the fractional portion. For example, 1.5 will become 0.5, and -0.1 will be turned into 0.9.

value.name: BRANCH
value.doc:
pc := src2_imm *if src0 COND src1*
Changes the current value of the instruction pointer if (src0 COND src1) evaluates to true.

value.name: TEXKILL
value.brief: Cancels rendering of the current fragment
value.doc:
Discards (kills) the current fragment. Can only be used in PS.
No input or output arguments.
XXX figure out if the COND bits are used. It appears not, as the blob generates BRANCH.XX based flow control around it.

value.name: TEXLD
value.doc:
dst := textureND(tex, src0)
Samples texture coordinate src0 with sampler tex, and returns the sampled color in temporary register dst.

value.name: SQRT
value.doc:
dst := sqrt(src2)
Computes the square root of src2 and puts the result in temporary register dst.

value.name: SIN
value.doc:
dst := sin(src2 * (PI/2))
Computes the sine of src2 and puts the result in temporary register dst.
The period of the sine is 4 and not 2 PI, thus to get normal behavior the instruction should be prefixed by a division by PI/2.

value.name: COS
value.doc:
dst := cos(src2 * (PI/2))
Computes the cosine of src2 and puts the result in temporary register dst.
The period of the cosine is 4 and not 2 PI, thus to get normal behavior the instruction should be prefixed by a division by PI/2.

value.name: FLOOR
value.brief: Largest integral value not greater than the argument
value.doc:
dst := floor(src2)
Computes the largest integral value not greater than the argument, and puts the result in temporary register dst.

value.name: CEIL
value.brief: Smallest integral value not less than the argument
value.doc:
dst := ceil(src2)
Computes the smallest integral value not less than the argument, and puts the result in temporary register dst.

value.name: SIGN
value.doc:
dst := sign(src2)
Return 1.0 if the sign is positive or zero, -1.0 if negative.

value.name: I2F
value.doc:
dst := float(src0)
Convert source operand to a float and put the result in temporary register dst.

value.name: IMULHI0
value.brief: High half of the product of x and y (mul_hi intrinsic)

enum.name: INST_RGROUP
enum.value: Only one register in this range is known: - 0.x: gl_FrontFacing (PS)

value.name: ADD_A_X
value.brief: Add a.x to the sampler or register index

value.name: ADD_A_Y
value.brief: Add a.y to the sampler or register index

value.name: ADD_A_Z
value.brief: Add a.z to the sampler or register index

value.name: ADD_A_W
value.brief: Add a.w to the sampler or register index

bitfield.name: TEX_SWIZ
bitfield.doc: This swizzle is applied to the components of the value fetched from the texture.
